page.title: 12Buildings of Blithfield
page.content: The village hall at Admaston has been converted from the old school buildings. It is used or whist drives, WI parties and for fund raising events. The reservoir forms a lake on the SE Side of Blithfield Hall, and on the outside can be seen turrents and battlement. The large gateway leads to an open courtyard with a lily pond. The dining room has green and gold elizabethan panelling with a display of 36 coats of arms. The great hall is resplendant with Gothic plaster work. The living quarters are now confined to 4 rooms and the rest is waiting to be altered into modern accommodation or once again to be opened to the public. The ornate gardens have been turned to lawns. Many of the old possesions are now in museums within the county. Much of the furniture was sold in 1946.
